thread.title: EU referendum: How would you vote if UK went to polls TODAY? | Leicester Mercury
thread.title_full: EU referendum: How would you vote if UK went to polls TODAY? | Leicester Mercury

author: Faith Dunne
title: EU referendum: How would you vote if UK went to polls TODAY? | Leicester Mercury
text:
Comments (2) 
Leicester marginally voted to remain in the European Union when the UK went to the polls in June. 
Some 51.1% of voters in the city voted to remain in the EU but it was a different story in the county where a majority backed Brexit. 
But would Leicestershire still back Brexit if the vote was held today? 
We are giving the people of Leicestershire another chance to see how they would vote, now knowing the result of the original referendum. 
The Leicester Mercury has set up a poll to give you another chance to cast your vote. How Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland voted in EU referendum 
Oadby and Wigston
